title: Can wearing a mask constantly cause CO2 poisoning or lead to other health issues? - Quora

response.answer_text: The presumption here first is that we’re talking about a new or professionally reconditioned mask and that the mask is a government-certified mask. If so, the answer is … Abso-Positively NOT, for a normal healthy person. Can some civilians do it wrong and have problems? Oh, heck yes. I saw some poor guy the other day that had worn one of those cheap papery things for so long, day after day after day that it was all skudgy and so wet with his breath vapor that it looked like he was trying to breathe underwater. Yes, under exercise or stress circumstances your body builds extra CO2 which tells your brain to breathe faster or deeper. So do it. Is that “CO2 poisoning”? Nope. That’s your body doing its job. There are medical procedure tricks of intentionally giving a patient a percentage of CO2 — far higher than you’ll ever get wearing a mask — when the doctors want to kick up breathing rates or depths. And while I’m ranting, let’s address those criminals publishing those YouTube videos about oxygen readings being dangerously low when wearing a mask. Think about it. You inhale. Your body removes a bit of the available oxygen. You exhale. Where does all of that exhalate go? A tiny bit never makes it out of the lungs; a little bit stays in your trachea and nasal passages; most of it goes “out there.” How big is the space between your nose and the inside of the mask? A tablespoon? Two tablespoons (in the case of those stupid pointy things coming from a country which shall remain nameless.)? Then you inhale. Yes, those two tablespoons, plus the stuff that never got out in the first place (because that’s how your body works) are “recycled” along with a huge dose of new full-oxygen air. Proof? Do this. Put on a well-fitted mask and breathe in it for 15 minutes. Now shift your concentration to your nose and the sensation of air temperature. Exhale. Inhale. Notice how the inhale cycle almost instantly turns to cool air? That rush of “cool” is full-oxygen fresh air. (I guess in Phoenix, AZ, right now the sensation might be “shockingly hotter air” but that’s not true for most of the world … yet.) I had better quit now. We don’t want to tax my blood pressure.

There is no such thing as “CO2 poisoning”. Don’t confuse with carbon monoxide (CO) poisoning. Excessive CO2 (10 percent or more) can lead to unconsciousness through asphyxiation because your oxygen is insufficient. The air you inhale is roughly 78% nitrogen, 21% oxygen, 0.04% CO2, and trace amounts of inert gases. Exhaled air is much the same except for oxygen now at about 17% and the CO2 around 4%. This still revives unconscious victims being given mouth-to-mouth resuscitation. In fact, elevated CO2 actually stimulates your breathing response (ever notice that when you hold your breath it doesn’t cause unconsciousness, but stimulates you to breathe more urgently? -That’s not the reduced oxygen, it’s the increased CO2.) Some of the exhaled breath remains in your nasopharynx, your trachea and bronchi, and is inhaled along with the incoming breath of fresh air. When swimming with a snorkel, you have a little more of this expired air to breathe in with each breath each time, but that is balanced by the slightly deeper breaths each time. Wearing a surgical or N95 mask reduces the volume of expired air you need to re-breathe to much less than using a snorkel tube. It’s about an extra mouthful, that’s all. If you are a really shallow breather, you might be bothered what seems to be the ‘warm’ air in the mask, but if you breathe very slightly deeper each time, you’ll get all the fresh air you need. Medical staff wear surgical masks for extended hours, and workers wear N95 respirators for a shift, all without becoming unconscious or experiencing difficulties.

Well it would be a lie to call it natural behavior. I think if you are screwing with any bodily function in an unnatural way you will get negative impact. What and how much is the realm of experiments but if they are harmful nobody is going to tap you on the shoulder guaranteed! You see the government has stolen your mental autonomy but you have to be able to think in order to protect yourself from snake oil mongers and car salespeople among other things. My dad used to buy cheap everything because he was conditioned to budget money by my grandmother. Five garden sprinklers later I bought him an expensive one for Christmas. He still has it twenty years later. Now he buys expensive because he can judge when it's warranted. Thinking ability. You have to think about masks carefully then make a personal decision about wearing one. Don't let the government order you or let people guilt you. Nobody cares about you except you. Turn on your brain the way a house activates it's alarm system against fire and burglary. Leave it on and process what's happening around you. If you don't think a mask is sensible don't wear one. If marijuana makes you paranoid don't smoke it. If you like the red shoes but they are three hundred just buy them!

Homeostasis requires air. The respiratory system, is vital for life. Air is hydrogen, carbon, oxygen, nitrogen, argon and others. The brain is required by the systems of the body. The brain requires, oxygen mostly. Levels under 19.5 are defined as clinically dangerous. Low levels of oxygen is called hypoxia A mask does not allow for a person to breathe air, instead, one is breathing exhaled air, containing mostly hydrogen. This is insufficient for the body to achieve homeostasis. Dizzines, confusion, disorientation, blurred vision, palpitations. Prolonged use of masks does lead to thrombocytopenia and a whole host of disorders including toxic shock syndrome and permanent brain damage. To remove oxygen alone, causes major repercussions. Conversely, hyperbaric oxygen treatment sucessfully cures many diseases. A mandate is not a statute of law. It does not matter which country you are from, it is illegal to enforce the wearing of masks. Nobody can tell ANYONE they cannot breathe air. I still have no clinical evidence this virus exists, as it has yet to be isolated. This is something I could do in 10 minutes. I hope this helps you. All the very best.

I think from my position as a scientist the answer is no, but this is a multivariable issue which conflicts the answer. Wearing masks are difficult for many people. If you need to walk the least, you will be panting soon. Just walking can be like hiking up a mountain. The better the mask—N95 without a valve can be distressing to nearly all of us and that is most likely from CO2 build up. There is no reason to wear a mask outdoors in uncrowded conditions except to show loyalty to those sick with Covid. If you are in a crowd were distancing is about right but people are talking to each other, than take you mask out of your pocket and put it on is my suggestion. In other world, don’t wear a mask while in your own car, your own house alone, etc. Take the mask off as much as possible, but use a good mask, multilayer cotton or surgical or an n95 or kn95 when you do wear one. No other options.

If you have COPD or some other respiratory diseases, mask can be a problem, and your doctor will give you a letter saying you cannot wear masks. Other than that , you do not rebreathe enough carbon dioxide to be harmful. But I rate masks to be just 5% effective and the CDC in US think they are very useless too. Masks are a political necessity , not a health necessity, unless you are a health professional, like a surgeon. Masks do protect the politician’s job, they make it look like they are doing something. Masks , distancing, hand washings, lock downs are all of questionable values. It is just politics. never under estimate the political angle, even the virus respect them. If you look around, the virus are much more dangerous in US Democratic controlled areas, but not Republican areas.

Breathing filter masks are PARTICLE filters, not GAS filters, and cannot prevent our inhale from receiving full external air, with a full balance of available oxygen. You may be thinking of restricted breathing because your mask is improperly fit, perhaps sucked up against your nostrils so that there is only a little fabric that you are breathing through, and you cannot inhale much, and you are getting exhausted. Get a better mask. Why do people think masks are one-size-fits-all? Do we go to a shoe store and say “… give me a pair of shoes …” and just take anything off the rack and go home? Get a mask with full airflow for your breathing volume. I like the fan-forced filtered-air masks, as illustrated, like airconditioning, my exhale is pushed out before my next inhale, and it's always fresh and cool. Keep comparison shopping, be a good consumer. And stop complaining about your shoes being too tight. .

It doesn't cause CO2 poisoning. Doctors wear masks for hours, even aside from Covid. Sometimes doctors are in a single surgery for more than 24 hours, wearing a mask the whole time. I knew a navy doctor who said that sometimes his surgeries went more than 24 hours, but he couldn't change and let another doctor do the surgery half way through, since the other doctor wouldn't know everything he had done.

No, it doesn't! Let us just observed the frontliners in the hospital, the surgeon and his team in the operating toom, these people wore the masks longer than anyone else. With this pandemic, not only mask is worn but faceshield over the mask too. The hospital health professionals never complaint of being out of oxygen and drowning in their own carbon dioxide. Felt dizzy, shortness of breath, etc. They performed their task well, they extend their working hours when understaff. They worked closely with Covid-19 patients. All face mask are breathable. That's the first requirements aside from filtration. Wear your mask but when there is a chance for you to breath freely, do it. Few seconds won't kill you. Be wise. Just wash the washable after every use. Don't wear the soiled one, the microbes will make you sick not the question of breathability!

No. This is a ridiculous claim being made by some, but there is no basis for it. Consider that when I worked in a hospital, I and colleagues sometimes wore masks for hours at a time. None of us ever suffered any ill effects because there is no practical difference in the air one breaths with a mask vs. without one.  Gosh, how are these people able to survive with those masks on?

I doubt that you would get CO2 poisoning, however if you were straining your system, and in need of oxygen it would slow your intake of oxygen, possibly causing a light headed fainting effect. It can cause your core temperature to rise leading to fever or heat stroke like effects. It is a germ breeding ground. Can lead to bad breathe or cold sore. Can worsen acne. Over all, best to use for protection from “large” particles such as dust, or other pollutant.

No. There are no serious issues. You may use a nice facial cream after wearing it for a long time and washing your face to calm the skin that may become dry. That is all. The biggest danger are people who do not agree with wearing a face mask and want to convince you of not doing it. They have to be frankly ignored. Also in the future.

Not sure you can poison anyone with CO2. Carbon dioxide is not toxic. The only time it is a problem is when it is in the air in two high a percentage; this goes NOT happen with masks. When you breathe through the cloth ambient air, oxygen, nitrogen, cones in. When exhaling is done carbon dioxide is exhaled and goes right out through the cloth, just like air. Then, lots of healthcare workers and lab workers wear masks for most of every day. They have done this for years and are perfectly fine.

I don’t think anyone wears one 24/7. Doctors and nurses wear them for their entire 12–16 hour shift. They are tested according to The Journal of Pulmonary Medicine and have no decrease in the pulse oximeters percentage. There have been problems with acne, facial “burns” from rubbing across ears and skin inflammation.

Greetings, I don’t know about CO2 poisoning but yes it can and does lead to other health issues. Psychological issues, fear, subjectifying people through “mandates,” is improper, wrong, and unethical. People are weary, overwhelmed, depressed, some are suicidal due to this nonsense.

CO2 poisoning is the number one cause of death among surgeons, dentists, and other health care workers. Fire fighter first-responders have a greater risk from medical calls where they wear medical masks than responding to structure fires. This is why you rarely see a an old doctor. Wait, that isn’t true. No, there is no risk from wearing a face mask. The same is not true if you are using a clear plastic bag as a face mask. Read the label warning on the bag.

I’m gonna point out that the question about “CO2 poisoning” has been done to death on Quora already. More than 50 answers here: Do face masks cause CO2 poisoning? And no, masks don’t lead to other health issues other than rashes and eczema on the faces of some unlucky health care workers.

Not if you change disposable masks frequently [1–2 uses], and properly wash and dry a reusable cloth mask. It is only when one tries to extend without proper use guidelines that issues arise, and even then CO2 poisoning or other respiratory issues are exceptionally unlikely.

Absolutely not.Been demonstrated and shown time and again it has no effect other than in people who THINK it does.And I won’t even go into all of us who wear/have worn masks as part of our jobs in medicine for the past thirty years.
I have never seen a problem like that with masks. I’ve worn them for a few hours at a time with no problem. Some nurses and surgeons and gas passers wear them for many more hours without problems.
Though wearing a mask constantly is overkill, I don't see how it could lead to health issues. Many people have been wearing màsks for years without issue. CO2 or carbon dioxide will not poison you.
Unlikely to cause CO2 poisoning, because the mask cannot hold a lung full of air and is therefore ventilated with each cycle. The increased humidity and warmth may cause discomfort to asthmatics

Not CO2 poisoning that is a conspiracy spread by anti-maskers. Other health issues are possible by constantly reusing the same mask without washing it. Bacterial infections are a risk so change theask regularly with a clean one.

Q. Can wearing a mask constantly cause CO2 poisoning (hypercarbia) or lead to other health issues? [edited] A. Definitely not. Such internet myths and hoaxes which gullible people read or hear about continue to be posted on sites like Quora, thus recycling this inane nonsense repeatedly. Does prolonged wearing of a facemask cause harm? Wearing a Mask: Myths and Facts
No health issues, the mask leaked on all sides so your exhale has no problems escaping. You inhale fresh air constantly through the filter and sides.
Healthy people tolerate mildly elevated cow levels. Those with COPD not so much. Those that have nasal passages colonized with staph can develop skin infections in mask area
NO! Mask quality is an issue … However, hand washing is a far greater defense. against infection by either a disease or an organism.
Lets hope not. There are thousands of people in the medical world who wear them for many hours a day. If there was a problem, I think we might have heard by now.
No. It cannot. Surgeons and operating room staff have been wearing them for decades,for many hours on end, and suffer no ill effects.
Not when used intelligently. Many professionals wear masks for long periods in their work every day.
Wearing the same mask constantly without cleaning can result in bacterial/fungal growth, no different than wearing the same underwear or socks over and over.
